content.rendered:
Ira Yair Gispan, a brave 19-year-old tank soldier from Petah Tikva, served with dedication in the 75th Battalion of the 7th Brigade. His life was tragically cut short in battle in the southern Gaza Strip, during the Iron Swords War, making him the first fallen soldier of the expanded military operation in Rafah. Ira’s legacy is one of courage, love for his country, and an enduring smile that touched the hearts of everyone he met.

Family Life

Ira was born into a close-knit family, the beloved son of Amit and Tali Gispan. He grew up with three siblings: an older brother who served in the Golani Brigade and two younger siblings still in middle and high school. Ira’s family was his anchor, and he was a source of pride and joy to his parents and siblings.

His father’s words in the wake of Ira’s death reflect the depth of their bond: “My world has collapsed. My beautiful, intelligent, brave, and courageous son fell in battle in Gaza. My beautiful Ira, how much I love you, only God knows. I don’t know how I will continue without you, my beautiful and beloved child. Keep watching over us; I love you more than anything in the world.” These heartfelt words express not only a father’s pain but also the immense pride he felt for his son’s bravery and dedication.

Military Service

Ira’s journey into the Israeli Defense Forces (IDF) was marked by his desire to serve his country in a meaningful way. Though he initially aspired to join the Golani Brigade, like his older brother, Ira was assigned to the Armored Corps. At first, he was hesitant, feeling that his path was meant to be elsewhere, but soon he embraced his role with pride and dedication. He learned to love his battalion, his fellow soldiers, and the tank he operated.

His former teacher, Shay Amit, described Ira as a “captivating young man, very intelligent, brave, and proud to join a combat role.” Ira had the opportunity to pursue academic paths but chose to become a fighter instead, driven by his sense of duty and love for his homeland. His courage and determination made a lasting impression on everyone who knew him.

Professional Life and Personal Achievements

Ira was more than just a soldier; he was a young man full of life and energy. Friends and family gathered in his neighborhood of Sha’ariya to pay their respects, sharing stories that painted a picture of his infectious charisma, his love of laughter, and his ability to bring light to any room. One friend mentioned his fondness for joking around at “Crazy Meat,” a local hangout, where his laughter was as much a part of the atmosphere as the food itself.

His teacher shared memories of Ira as a mischievous student with a smile that made it impossible to be upset with him. Ira had a way of brightening people’s lives, and this spirit carried through to his military service. Despite the challenges, he remained optimistic and dedicated, symbolizing the very essence of selfless service.

A Legacy of Bravery and Light

Ira’s name holds a special meaning that matched his character perfectly. In Hebrew, “Ira” refers to a warrior-like strength, reminiscent of Ira the priest, a loyal companion to King David, and “Yair” means “to illuminate.” True to his name, Ira Yair Gispan was a beacon of light, spreading warmth and courage to those around him. Even in his final moments, he exemplified the qualities of a true hero—standing firm in the face of adversity and fighting for what he believed in.

Ira’s ultimate sacrifice on the battlefield in Gaza is a testament to his unyielding courage and dedication to protecting his homeland. He stood as a guardian for Israel, and his memory will forever inspire those who continue the fight for peace and security. His family’s loss is profound, but his spirit lives on in the hearts of all who knew him and in the nation he gave his life to defend.

In Memory

Ira Yair Gispan will be remembered as a hero who chose to serve with pride and unwavering commitment, even when faced with the hardest challenges. His life was a testament to courage, love, and the light that he shared with everyone around him. Ira’s story is not just one of sacrifice but also of the enduring impact that a young man can have on his family, friends, and his nation.

May his memory be a blessing, and may his light continue to shine in the hearts of all those who knew and loved him.

First Name

Ira

Last Name

Yair Gispan

Age

19

Fell On

Army Unit

7th Armored Brigade

Army Rank

Sergeant

יהי זכרו ברוך

excerpt.rendered: Ira Yair Gispan fell in battle during a tank operation in southern Gaza, bravely defending Israel against enemy forces.
